It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiky inflorescences. The plant typically grows in humid, tropical environments and thrives in shaded to semi-shaded conditions. Its leaves are often hairy and have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense, spiny structures. This variant is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its unique appearance.
